instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
No liquid damage green light turns orange
G3h 12.55v,
Pp5v and p3v3 all present down to s0.
All_sys_pwrgd 0.070 not shorted to gnd

What makes all_sys_pwrgd?

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
Post voltages for pins 1, 5, 7 of Q7950.
Not really needed, it could be removed.

"All_sys_pwrgd 0.070 not shorted to gnd"
Diode mode, or voltage?
Too low value for diode mode.
You can remove R7963-9, one by one, until ALL_SYS_PWRGD comes high.
Do NOT remove R7967; be sure is good.

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
Q7950
Pin1 0.746v
Pin2 0.706v
Pin3 0.777v

All_sys_pwrgd 0.70v, 0.430 diode mode red on ground

R7697 good 10k

When removed R7968 all_sys_pwrgd goes 3.3v and boots

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
Do you get 1.5V at L7770?
Change U7710...

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message: changed U7710 pins of l7770 are now fluctating between 1-2.4v and machine tries to boot when in the 1.5v range then shutsoff when above 1.8v

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
All the resistors for u7710 circuit measure correct and changed all caps to be safe still same behavior
Changed U7710 again to be sure still same behavior

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message: Did you get 1.5V before changing U7710?

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
2V no good, that was the reason to pull down ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
Check R7780/81, look at the formula...

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
Yeah what i dont understand is why its giving up to 2.4v,
all the resistors are good

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message: Adjust one of these resistors to get the correct 1.5V output...

threads.title: 820-3332 in S0 but no All_sys_pwrgd
threads.message:
Removed L6201 got steady 1.5v
C6211 was causing the problems even though it was measuring and looked fine

All fixed thank you
